ğŸ¤˜ğŸ» Why Chrome Capture is for you:
â€¢ Selected area screenshots and screen recording.
â€¢ Full tab screenshots and recordings.
â€¢ Desktop recordings.
â€¢ Full webpage screenshots.
â€¢ Save recordings as a GIF or WebM video file.
â€¢ Edit recordings and screenshots in our easy to use editor.
â€¢ Share recordings and screenshots with ease.
â€¢ Constant updates and improvements to become the best GIF screen recorder & screenshot extension!

ğŸƒğŸ¾ Shortcuts
â€¢ Alt + c: open Chrome Capture snipping/cropping tool.
â€¢ Alt + s: take a screenshot.
â€¢ Alt + Shift + s: take a full page screenshot (beta).
â€¢ Alt + r: start/stop recording.
â€¢ Esc: close Chrome Capture snipping tool.
â€¢ You may need to configure these in chrome://extensions/shortcuts.
â€¢ Shortcuts make full screen capture much easier!

âœ‚ï¸ Cropping tool
â€¢ Capture exactly what you want with an intuitive cropping tool.
â€¢ Interactive with the web page while recording.
â€¢ Select, move, resize, snap.
â€¢ Right click to snap to element/website area e.g. video, image, text.
â€¢ Shift + right click for multiple elements

ğŸ–Šï¸ Edit
â€¢ Add text.
â€¢ Draw arrows.
â€¢ Free hand draw.
â€¢ Speed up/slow down recordings.
â€¢ Resize, move, rotate, annotations.
â€¢ Zoom in and out.
â€¢ Change recording and screenshot resolution.
â€¢ Add a range of SVG icons to screenshots and recordings.
â€¢ Frame editing.
â€¢ Compress animated GIF files.
â€¢ More coming soon..

ğŸš€ Share
â€¢ Download.
â€¢ Copy images to clipboard (right click -> copy).
â€¢ Open in browser.

âŒ Not supported
â€¢ GIFs are not intended for long recordings - use WEBMs for this!
â€¢ No sound recording - yet..
â€¢ Chrome extensions do not work in the Chrome web store.
â€¢ High frame rate long recordings are memory and CPU intensive.

ğŸ‘ Free ğŸ‘
â€¢ Unlimited screenshots.

â€¢ Download, copy, open.

â­ Premium â­

â€¢ Up to 20 Frames per second.
â€¢ Draw on screen while recording.

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ”§ Some user cases:
â€¢ Communicate better with your team by creating and sharing a short GIF or WebM.
â€¢ Record snip-its of videos on YouTube and other sites into GIFs or WebMs to share on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.
â€¢ Capture visual information which can't be demonstrated with an image.
â€¢ Record an animated GIF of your screen to show how to fill out a website form.
â€¢ Record and attach a GIF to Jira/Trello to show how to reproduce a bug.
â€¢ Amazingly quick annotated screenshots to get a point across to a friend or colleague.
â€¢ Everyone loves a good animated GIF, now create your own!

â” Having trouble using this
1. Start Chrome Capture by left clicking the Chrome Capture icon.
2. Select an area of the screen using the crop tool.
3. Adjust settings to your preference by clicking the settings icon.
4. Click the camera icon to take a screenshot of the selected area or click the video icon to start recording the selected are (click again to stop recording).
5. Close the crop tool.

â” Having trouble using this
1. Start Chrome Capture by left clicking the Chrome Capture icon.
2. Select an area of the screen using the crop tool.
3. Adjust settings to your preference by clicking the settings icon.
4. Click the camera icon to take a screenshot of the selected area or click the video icon to start recording the selected are (click again to stop recording).
5. Close the crop tool.
6. Watch the YouTube video to see it all in action - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LYmvbSzAY5k

ğŸ‘¼ Permissions explained:
â€¢ activeTab: required to insert cropping tool overlay into the current tab so an area can be selected record/capture.
â€¢ storage: required to store user settings.
â€¢ tabCapture: required to capture/record tabs to turn to screenshots, GIFs or video.
â€¢ contextMenus: required to add context menu (right click) options for many different ways to capture.
â€¢ notifications: required to display a silent notification when fullscreen capture starts as it is not very obvious without it.
